request.description:
### Get Role

This endpoint sends an HTTP GET request to retrieve the list of roles.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- `status` (boolean): Indicates the status of the response.
    
- `message` (string): Provides any additional information about the response.
    
- `count` (integer): Represents the count of roles returned in the response.
    
- `data` (array): Contains the list of roles, which is empty in this case.
    

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Role retrieved successfully.",
    "count": 1,
    "data": [
        {
            "id": "d87771de-1aa7-49bf-b9ea-1fee23db2ab1",
            "role_name": "Test Rep",
            "is_global": false,
            "organization": "2dfe251d-e9ea-4a4e-9966-1e4689f36848",
            "description": "Can manage Super Sales Rep",
            "menu_permissions": [
                {
                    "menu_id": "b19e95b9-7606-4651-a0c6-0db3694355f0",
                    "menu_name": "Dashboard",
                    "menu_code": "Dash001",
                    "permission": {
                        "create": true,
                        "view": true,
                        "update": false,
                        "delete": false
                    }
                },
                {
                    "menu_id": "5aa24494-71ff-4372-8500-9e5d4a82eff6",
                    "menu_name": "payment",
                    "menu_code": "pay001",
                    "permission": {
                        "create": false,
                        "view": true,
                        "update": false,
                        "delete": false
                    }
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}

 ```

### Get Role

This endpoint sends an HTTP GET request to retrieve the list of roles.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- `status` (boolean): Indicates the status of the response.
    
- `message` (string): Provides any additional information about the response.
    
- `count` (integer): Represents the count of roles returned in the response.
    
- `data` (array): Contains the list of roles, which is empty in this case.
    

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Role retrieved successfully.",
    "count": 1,
    "data": [
        {
            "id": "d87771de-1aa7-49bf-b9ea-1fee23db2ab1",
            "role_name": "Test Rep",

            "description": "Can manage Super Sales Rep",
            "menu_permissions": [
                {
                    "menu_id": "b19e95b9-7606-4651-a0c6-0db3694355f0",

                    "permission": {
                        "create": true,

                },

 ```

### Get Role Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific role based on the provided role ID.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{BaseUrl}}role/d87771de-1aa7-49bf-b9ea-1fee23db2ab1/`
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

##### Response Body

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "",
    "data": {
        "id": "",
        "role_name": "",
        "is_global": true,
        "organization": "",
        "description": "",
        "menu_permissions": [
            {
                "menu_id": "",
                "menu_name": "",
                "menu_code": "",
                "permission": {
                    "create": true,
                    "view": true,
                    "update": true,
                    "delete": true
                }
            }
        ]
    }
}

 ```

The response contains the status of the request, an optional message, and the data related to the role, including its ID, name, global status, organization, description, and menu permissions with create, view, update, and delete access.

### Create New Role

This endpoint allows the client to create a new role with the specified details.

#### Request Body

- `role_name` (string): The name of the role.
    
- `description` (string): A brief description of the role.
    
- `is_global` (boolean): Indicates whether the role is global or not.
    
- `organization` (string): The organization ID to which the role belongs.
    
- `permissions` (array): An array of permissions for the role, each containing:
    
    - `menu_id` (string): The ID of the menu associated with the permission.
        
    - `permission` (object): The permission object with keys:
        
        - `create` (boolean): Indicates if the role has create permission.
            
        - `view` (boolean): Indicates if the role has view permission.
            
        - `update` (boolean): Indicates if the role has update permission.
            
        - `delete` (boolean): Indicates if the role has delete permission.
            

Error message:-  
{

"status": false,

"message": "Role creation failed.",

"errors": {

"non_field_errors": \[ "The fields role_name, organization must make a unique set." \]

}}

#### Response (JSON Schema)

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Role retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": "d87771de-1aa7-49bf-b9ea-1fee23db2ab1",
        "role_name": "Test Rep",
        "is_global": false,
        "organization": "2dfe251d-e9ea-4a4e-9966-1e4689f36848",
        "description": "Can manage Super Sales Rep",
        "menu_permissions": [
            {
                "menu_id": "b19e95b9-7606-4651-a0c6-0db3694355f0",
                "menu_name": "Dashboard",
                "menu_code": "Dash001",
                "permission": {
                    "create": true,
                    "view": true,
                    "update": false,
                    "delete": false
                }
            },
            {
                "menu_id": "5aa24494-71ff-4372-8500-9e5d4a82eff6",
                "menu_name": "payment",
                "menu_code": "pay001",
                "permission": {
                    "create": false,
                    "view": true,
                    "update": false,
                    "delete": false
                }
            }
        ]
    }
}

 ```

This HTTP PUT request is used to update a specific role identified by the ID in the URL. The request payload should include the updated role name, global status, organization, description, and menu permissions with their respective details and permissions.

### Request Payload

- `role_name`: (string) The updated name of the role.
    
- `is_global`: (boolean) The global status of the role.
    
- `organization`: (string) The ID of the organization associated with the role.
    
- `description`: (string) The updated description of the role.
    
- `menu_permissions`: (array) An array of menu permissions containing:
    
    - `menu_id`: (string) The ID of the menu.
        
    - `menu_name`: (string) The name of the menu.
        
    - `menu_code`: (string) The code of the menu.
        
    - `permission`: (object) The permissions for the menu, including create, view, update, and delete.
        

### Expected Response Format

Upon successful execution, the response will have a status code of 200 and a JSON content type. The response body will include:

- `status`: (boolean) Indicates the status of the request.
    
- `message`: (string) Any additional message related to the request.
    
- `data`: (object) The updated role data containing:
    
    - `id`: (string) The ID of the role.
        
    - `role_name`: (string) The updated name of the role.
        
    - `is_global`: (boolean) The global status of the role.
        
    - `organization`: (string) The ID of the organization associated with the role.
        
    - `description`: (string) The updated description of the role.
        
    - `menu_permissions`: (array) An array of updated menu permissions containing:
        
        - `menu_id`: (string) The ID of the menu.
            
        - `menu_name`: (string) The name of the menu.
            
        - `menu_code`: (string) The code of the menu.
            
        - `permission`: (object) The updated permissions for the menu, including create, view, update, and delete.

Pagination Role

### GET /role/?page=1&page_size=3

This endpoint retrieves a list of roles with pagination.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- BaseUrl: {{BaseUrl}}
    
- Path: /role/
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number): The page number for pagination.
        
    - page_size (number): The number of items per page.
        

#### Response

The response is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Role retrieved successfully.",
    "count": 1,
    "data": [
        {
            "id": "d87771de-1aa7-49bf-b9ea-1fee23db2ab1",
            "role_name": "Test Rep Update",
            "is_global": false,
            "organization": "2dfe251d-e9ea-4a4e-9966-1e4689f36848",
            "description": "Can manage TEst Sales Rep",
            "menu_permissions": [
                {
                    "menu_id": "b19e95b9-7606-4651-a0c6-0db3694355f0",
                    "menu_name": "Dashboard",
                    "menu_code": "Dash001",
                    "permission": {
                        "create": true,
                        "view": true,
                        "update": false,
                        "delete": false
                    }
                },
                {
                    "menu_id": "5aa24494-71ff-4372-8500-9e5d4a82eff6",
                    "menu_name": "payment",
                    "menu_code": "pay001",
                    "permission": {
                        "create": false,
                        "view": true,
                        "update": false,
                        "delete": false
                    }
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}

 ```

This endpoint retrieves a list of roles with optional pagination and search functionality. The request should be sent via an HTTP GET method to the specified URL with the "page" parameter for pagination, "page_size" parameter to define the number of items per page, and an optional "search" parameter to filter the results based on the role name.

### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: {{BaseUrl}}role/
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (integer): The page number for pagination.
        
    - page_size (integer): The number of items per page.
        
    - search (string): Optional parameter to filter results based on role name.
        
    - search by :- organization name,Role name,phone number , email
        

### Response

Upon a successful execution (Status: 200), the response will be in JSON format with the following structure:

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "",
    "count": 0,
    "data": [
        {
            "id": "",
            "role_name": "",
            "is_global": true,
            "organization": "",
            "description": "",
            "menu_permissions": [
                {
                    "menu_id": "",
                    "menu_name": "",
                    "menu_code": "",
                    "permission": {
                        "create": true,
                        "view": true,
                        "update": true,
                        "delete": true
                    }
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}

 ```

The "data" array contains the list of roles with their respective details, including role ID, name, global status, organization, description, and menu permissions. Each menu permission includes the menu ID, name, code, and the associated permissions for create, view, update, and delete.

This endpoint retrieves role information based on the provided parameters. The request is an HTTP GET to {{BaseUrl}}role/ with the following query parameters:

- Filter by :-
    

role_name,organization,is_global(true/false)

The response to the request has a status code of 200 and a content type of application/json. The response body contains the following fields:

- status: Indicates the status of the response
    
- message: Provides any additional message related to the response
    
- count: The total count of roles returned
    
- data: An array containing role information with the following attributes:
    
    - id: The unique identifier for the role
        
    - role_name: The name of the role
        
    - is_global: Indicates if the role is global
        
    - organization: The organization associated with the role
        
    - description: Description of the role
        
    - menu_permissions: An array of menu permissions containing the following attributes:
        
        - menu_id: The unique identifier for the menu
            
        - menu_name: The name of the menu
            
        - menu_code: The code associated with the menu
            
        - permission: Object containing the permissions for the menu, including create, view, update, and delete

### Ordering role

This endpoint retrieves a list of roles with pagination and ordering.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: {{BaseUrl}}role/?page=1&page_size=4&ordering=-role_name
    
- ordeing by :-

#### Response

### Create Organization

This endpoint allows the creation of a new organization.

**Request Body**

Organization details:-

- `org_name` (string): The name of the organization.
    
- `address` (string): The address of the organization.
    
- `phone` (string): The contact phone number of the organization.
    
- `email` (string): The contact email of the organization.
    
- `website` (string): The website URL of the organization.
    

Create User :-

- `username` (string): The username for the organization admin.
    
- `user_email` (string): The email of the organization admin.
    
- `first_name` (string): The first name of the organization admin.
    
- `last_name` (string): The last name of the organization admin.
    
- `password` (string): The password for the organization admin.
    

Menu and Permissions :-

- `menu_permissions` (array): An array of menu permissions with menu code, create, view, update, and delete permissions.
    

**Response**

request.description:
### Get User Details

This endpoint sends an HTTP GET request to retrieve user details from the server.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

If user has organization then it will show only its details

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

The response will include a JSON object with the following fields:

- `status` (boolean): Indicates the status of the response.
    
- `message` (string): Provides any additional message related to the response.
    
- `data` (array): Contains an array of user objects, each with the following attributes:
    
    - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the user.
        
    - `username` (string): The username of the user.
        
    - `email` (string): The email address of the user.
        
    - `phone_number` (string): The phone number of the user.
        
    - `first_name` (string): The first name of the user.
        
    - `middle_name` (string): The middle name of the user.
        
    - `last_name` (string): The last name of the user.
        
    - `role_id` (string): The role identifier of the user.
        
    - `organization_id` (string): The organization identifier of the user.
        
    - `full_name` (string): The full name of the user.

Retrive user

### Request Body

- No parameters included in the form-data request body.
    

### Response

The response will have a status code of 200 and a content type of application/json. The response body will contain a JSON object with the following fields:

- status (boolean): Indicates the status of the request.
    
- message (string): Provides any additional information or messages.
    
- data (object): Contains the user information with the following fields:
    
    - id (string): User ID.
        
    - username (string): User's username.
        
    - email (string): User's email address.
        
    - phone_number (string): User's phone number.
        
    - first_name (string): User's first name.
        
    - middle_name (string): User's middle name.
        
    - last_name (string): User's last name.
        
    - role_id (string): ID of the user's role.
        
    - organization_id (string): ID of the user's organization, or null if not applicable.
        
    - full_name (string): User's full name.

### Create New User

This endpoint allows the client to create a new user by sending a POST request to the specified URL.

#### Request Body

- **username**: (string) The username of the user.
    
- **email**: (string) The email address of the user.
    
- **phone_number**: (string) The phone number of the user.
    
- **first_name**: (string) The first name of the user.
    
- **last_name**: (string) The last name of the user.
    
- **role_id**: (string) The ID of the role assigned to the user.
    
- **organization_id**: (string) The ID of the organization to which the user belongs.
    
- **full_name**: (string) The full name of the user.
    

#### Response

The response of this request is a JSON schema representing the user object created. The schema includes the properties such as user ID, username, email, phone number, first name, last name, role ID, organization ID, and full name.

### Update User Details

This endpoint allows updating user details by sending an HTTP PUT request

#### Request Body

The request should include a JSON payload with the following key:

- Any key of User to update : The updated key value of the user.
    

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "id": "",
    "username": "",
    "email": "",
    "phone_number": "",
    "first_name": "",
    "middle_name": null,
    "last_name": "",
    "role_id": "",
    "organization_id": null,
    "full_name": ""
}

 ```

The response will include the updated user details with empty values for the fields that were not updated.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of users. The request should include the following parameters in the query string:

- `page`: (integer) The page number for the user list.
    
- `page_size`: (integer) The number of users to be included in each page of the response.
    

### Request Headers

No specific request headers were mentioned.

### Response

Upon a successful execution, the server will respond with a status code of 200 and a JSON object in the response body. The response will contain the following fields:

- `status`: (boolean) Indicates the status of the response.
    
- `message`: (string) Represents any additional message related to the response.
    
- `data`: (array) Contains a list of user objects, with each object having the following attributes:
    
    - `id`: (string) The unique identifier for the user.
        
    - `username`: (string) The username of the user.
        
    - `email`: (string) The email address of the user.
        
    - `phone_number`: (string) The phone number of the user.
        
    - `first_name`: (string) The first name of the user.
        
    - `middle_name`: (string) The middle name of the user.
        
    - `last_name`: (string) The last name of the user.
        
    - `role_id`: (string) The role identifier of the user.
        
    - `organization_id`: (string) The identifier of the organization to which the user belongs, or null if not applicable.
        
    - `full_name`: (string) The full name of the user.

This endpoint retrieves user data based on the provided parameters.

### Request

- Method: GET
    
- BaseUrl: {{BaseUrl}}
    
- Endpoint: /user/
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (integer): The page number for pagination.
        
    - page_size (integer): The number of items per page.
        
    - search (string): The search term to filter the user data.
        
    - search by :- 'username', 'email', 'phone_number', 'created_at',
        

### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- {
    

"status": true,

"message": "",

"data": \[ { "id": "", "username": "", "email": "", "phone_number": "", "first_name": "", "middle_name": null, "last_name": "", "role_id": null, "organization_id": null, "full_name": "" } \]

}

The response contains a boolean status, a message, and an array of user data objects with their respective attributes.

This endpoint retrieves user data based on the provided query parameters. The request should include the page number, page size, and phone number for filtering the results.

### Request Parameters

- `page` (integer): The page number for pagination.
    
- `page_size` (integer): The number of items per page.
    
- `phone_number` (string): The phone number used for filtering.
    
- Filter By;-
    
- 'username', 'email', 'phone_number', 'organization', 'role', 'is_active', 'is_superuser', 'is_staff'
    

### Response

Upon a successful execution, the response will have a status code of 200 and a JSON body with the following structure:

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": "",
            "username": "",
            "email": "",
            "phone_number": "",
            "first_name": "",
            "middle_name": "",
            "last_name": "",
            "role_id": "",
            "organization_id": null,
            "full_name": ""
        }
    ]
}

 ```

The `status` field indicates the success of the request, while the `data` array contains user information matching the provided criteria.

request.description:
### User Logout

This endpoint is used to logout the user by revoking the refresh token.

#### Request Body

- refresh (string, required): The refresh token to be revoked.
    

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "detail": "string"
}

 ```

- message (string): A message indicating the result of the logout operation.

### User Forgot Username

This endpoint is used to initiate the process of retrieving a forgotten username.

#### Request Body

- email (string, required): The email address associated with the user's account.
    

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Your username has been sent to your email address."
}

 ```

- username (string): The username associated with the provided email address.

### Set New Password Request

This endpoint is used to initiate the process of setting a new password for a user account.

#### Request Body

- email (string, required): The email address of the user for whom the new password is to be set.
    

#### Response

Upon successful execution, the response will include the following fields:

- status (boolean): Indicates the status of the request.
    
- message (string): A message related to the status of the request.
    
- token (string): The token associated with the password reset request.
    
- name (string): The name of the user.
    
- email (string): The email address of the user.

### User Check Password Reset Link

This endpoint is used to check the validity of a password reset token.

#### Request

- Method: POST
    
- BaseUrl: {{BaseUrl}}
    
- Endpoint: /user/checkpasswordresetlink/
    
- Headers:
    
    - Content-Type: application/json
        
- Body:
    
    - token (string, required): The password reset token to be checked.
        

#### Response

The response is in JSON format and follows the schema below:

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Password reset link is valid"
}

 ```

- status (boolean): Indicates the validity of the password reset token.
    
- message (string): An optional message related to the token validation.

### Set New Password

This endpoint is used to set a new password for a user.

#### Request Body

- `password` (string) - The new password for the user.
    
- `token` (string) - The token for verification.
    

#### Response

The response is in JSON format and has the following schema:

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Password has been updated"
}

 ```

### Change Password

This endpoint allows the user to change their password.

#### Request

- Method: POST
    
- Body:
    
    - `old_password` (text, required): The current password of the user.
        
    - `new_password` (text, required): The new password that the user wants to set.
        
    - Old and new password should not be equal
        

#### Response

The response is in JSON format and follows the schema below:

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Password changed successfully"
}

 ```

### GET /patient/

This endpoint retrieves a list of patient data.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `status` (boolean): Indicates the status of the response.
    
- `data` (array): An array of patient objects, each containing the following properties:
    
    - `id` (string): The unique identifier for the patient.
        
    - `address` (object): The address details of the patient, including various address fields.
        
    - `created_at` (string): The timestamp of when the patient record was created.
        
    - `updated_at` (string): The timestamp of when the patient record was last updated.
        
    - `patient_first_name` (string): The first name of the patient.
        
    - `patient_last_name` (string): The last name of the patient.
        
    - `patient_preferred_name` (string): The preferred name of the patient, if available.
        
    - `patient_prefix` (string): The prefix of the patient's name, if available.
        
    - `patient_suffix` (string): The suffix of the patient's name, if available.
        
    - `patient_middle_name` (string): The middle name of the patient, if available.
        
    - `patient_ssn` (string): The Social Security Number of the patient, if available.
        
    - `patient_account_number` (string): The account number of the patient, if available.
        
    - `patient_email` (string): The email address of the patient.
        
    - `patient_date_of_birth` (string): The date of birth of the patient.
        
    - `patient_phone_number` (string): The primary phone number of the patient.
        
    - `patient_alternate_phone_number` (string): The alternate phone number of the patient, if available.
        
    - `patient_id` (string): The unique identifier for the patient.
        
    - `is_active` (boolean): Indicates whether the patient is active.
        
    - `created_by` (string): The user who created the patient record, if available.
        
    - `updated_by` (string): The user who last updated the patient record, if available.
        
    - `organization` (string): The organization associated with the patient.
        
- `message` (string): Any additional message related to the response.
    
- `count` (number): The count of patient records returned in the response.
    

#### Example

``` json
{
  "status": true,
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "",
      "address": {
        "id": "",
        "created_at": "",
        "updated_at": null,
        "address_type": "",
        "address_1": "",
        "address_2": "",
        "street": "",
        "city": "",
        "state_name": "",
        "country": "",
        "postal_zip_code": "",
        "google_address": "",
        "is_primary": true
      },
      "created_at": "",
      "updated_at": "",
      "patient_first_name": "",
      "patient_last_name": "",
      "patient_preferred_name": null,
      "patient_prefix": null,
      "patient_suffix": null,
      "patient_middle_name": null,
      "patient_ssn": null,
      "patient_account_number": null,
      "patient_email": "",
      "patient_date_of_birth": "",
      "patient_phone_number": "",
      "patient_alternate_phone_number": null,
      "patient_id": null,
      "is_active": true,
      "created_by": null,
      "updated_by": null,
      "organization": ""
    }
  ],
  "message": "",
  "count": 0
}

 ```

request.description:
### Create New Patient

This endpoint allows you to create a new patient with the provided details.

#### Request Body

- `patient_first_name` (string): The first name of the patient.
    
- `patient_last_name` (string): The last name of the patient.
    
- `patient_email` (string): The email address of the patient.
    
- `patient_date_of_birth` (string): The date of birth of the patient.
    
- `patient_phone_number` (string): The phone number of the patient.
    
- `address` (object): The address details of the patient.
    
    - `address_type` (string): The type of address (e.g. work, home).
        
    - `address_1` (string): The first line of the address.
        
    - `address_2` (string): The second line of the address.
        
    - `street` (string): The street name.
        
    - `city` (string): The city name.
        
    - `state_name` (string): The state name.
        
    - `country` (string): The country name.
        
    - `postal_zip_code` (string): The postal/zip code.
        
    - `google_address` (string): The Google address.
        
    - `is_primary` (boolean): Indicates if this is the primary address.
        

#### Response (201 - Created)

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

request.description:
### POST /patient/

This endpoint is used to create a new patient record.

#### Request

The request should be sent as an HTTP POST to the base URL followed by `/patient/`. The request body should be in JSON format and include the following parameters:

- `patient_first_name` (string): The first name of the patient.
    
- `patient_last_name` (string): The last name of the patient.
    
- `patient_email` (string): The email address of the patient.
    
- `patient_date_of_birth` (string): The date of birth of the patient in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.
    
- `patient_phone_number` (string): The phone number of the patient.
    
- `address` (object): An object containing the address details of the patient, including:
    
    - `address_type` (string): The type of address (e.g., home, work).
        
    - `address_1` (string): The first line of the address.
        
    - `address_2` (string): The second line of the address.
        
    - `street` (string): The street name.
        
    - `city` (string): The city name.
        
    - `state_name` (string): The state name.
        
    - `country` (string): The country name.
        
    - `postal_zip_code` (string): The postal or zip code.
        
    - `google_address` (string): The Google address.
        
    - `is_primary` (boolean): Indicates if this is the primary address.
        

Example request body:

``` json
{
  "patient_first_name": "John",
  "patient_last_name": "Doe",
  "patient_email": "john.doe3@example.com",
  "patient_date_of_birth": "1990-01-01",
  "patient_phone_number": "1234567893",
  "address": {
    "address_type": "work",
    "address_1": "456 Avenue",
    "address_2": "Suite 5A",
    "street": "Main Blvd",
    "city": "CityA",
    "state_name": "StateA",
    "country": "CountryA",
    "postal_zip_code": "123456",
    "google_address": "456 Avenue, Suite 5A, Main Blvd ...",
    "is_primary": true
  }
}

 ```

#### Response

The response to this request will be a JSON object representing the newly created patient record. For the JSON schema of the response, please refer to the API documentation.

request.description:
### Update Patient Details

This endpoint allows updating the details of a specific patient.

#### Request Body

- `patient_first_name` (string): The updated first name of the patient.
    
- `patient_last_name` (string): The updated last name of the patient.
    
- `patient_date_of_birth` (string): The updated date of birth of the patient.
    
- `address` (object): The updated address details of the patient.
    
    - `address_type` (string): The type of address (e.g., home, work, etc.).
        
    - `address_1` (string): The first line of the updated address.
        
    - `address_2` (string): The second line of the updated address.
        
    - `street` (string): The street of the updated address.
        
    - `city` (string): The city of the updated address.
        
    - `state_name` (string): The state name of the updated address.
        
    - `country` (string): The country of the updated address.
        
    - `postal_zip_code` (string): The postal or zip code of the updated address.
        
    - `google_address` (string): The updated Google address.
        
    - `is_primary` (boolean): Indicates if the updated address is the primary address.
        

#### Response Body

The response body will contain the updated details of the patient.

The API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a paginated list of patient records. The request includes query parameters for page number and page size.

### Response

The response is in JSON format with a status of 200. It includes the following fields:

- status (boolean): Indicates the status of the response.
    
- data (array): An array containing patient records, where each record includes various patient details such as ID, address, name, contact information, date of birth, and organization.
    
- message: A message field, which appears to be empty in this response.
    
- count: The count of patient records, which is currently 0.
    

Here is a JSON schema representing the structure of the response:

``` json
{
    "status": true,

        {
            "id": "02c1499c-a7b2-4750-9c8c-8391b4ff4839",

 ```

### Request Description

This endpoint retrieves user data with optional pagination and search parameters. The `page` parameter specifies the page number, `page_size` specifies the number of results per page, and `search` allows searching based on a specific value.

### Request Body

This request does not contain a request body.

### Response Body

The response is in JSON format and includes a schema for the data returned. The `status` field indicates the success status of the request, `message` provides any additional information, and `data` contains an array of user objects with various attributes such as `id`, `username`, `email`, `phone_number`, `first_name`, `middle_name`, `last_name`, `role_id`, `organization_id`, and `full_name`.

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Users retrieved successfully.",

            "organization_id": "2dfe251d-e9ea-4a4e-9966-1e4689f36848",
            "full_name": "Sharma, Anil"
        }
    ]
}

 ```

request.description:
**API Name**: Create Emergency Contact  
**Method**: `POST`  
**URL**: `{{BaseUrl}}patient/emergency-contact/`

**Description**:  
  
Creates a new emergency contact for a patient. This includes the contact's name, relationship to the patient, and their address details.

---

### **Request Body (JSON)**:

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "patient": "02c1499c-a7b2-4750-9c8c-8391b4ff4839",
  "relationship": "db994a57-7083-4564-973a-bc36a9f7de13",
  "first_name": "John emergency test",
  "last_name": "Doe",
  "middle_name": "M",
  "emergency_contact_address": {
    "address_type": "work",
    "address_1": "456 Avenue",
    "address_2": "Suite 5A",
    "street": "Main Blvd",
    "city": "CityA",
    "state_name": "StateA",
    "country": "CountryA",
    "postal_zip_code": "123456",
    "google_address": "456 Avenue, Suite 5A, Main Blvd, CityA, CountryA",
    "is_primary": true
  }
}

 ```

---

**Field Descriptions**:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `patient` | UUID | ID of the patient for whom the emergency contact is being created. |
| `relationship` | UUID | ID of the relationship (e.g., Father, Mother, Friend). |
| `first_name` | string | First name of the emergency contact. |
| `last_name` | string | Last name of the emergency contact. |
| `middle_name` | string | Middle name of the emergency contact (optional). |
| `emergency_contact_address` | object | Address object of the emergency contact. Includes: |
| `address_type` | string | Type of address (e.g., work, home). |
| `address_1` | string | First line of the address (street). |
| `address_2` | string | Second line of the address (suite, apartment, etc.). |
| `street` | string | The street name for the address. |
| `city` | string | The city where the emergency contact resides. |
| `state_name` | string | The state where the emergency contact resides. |
| `country` | string | The country where the emergency contact resides. |
| `postal_zip_code` | string | The postal/zip code of the address. |
| `google_address` | string | Full address in a Google Maps-compatible format. |
| `is_primary` | boolean | Whether this is the primary address (true or false). |

---

### **Response (Success)**:

```

### **Create Branch Office**

**API Name**: Create Branch Office  
**Method**: `POST`  
**URL**: `{{BaseUrl}}branch-office/`

**Description**:  
  
Creates a new branch office record and associates it with an organization.

---

**Request Body (JSON)**:

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "branch_office_name": "Ahmedabad test Main Branch",
  "branch_office_code": "AMD021",
  "branch_office_address": "123 Satellite Road, Near Iskon Cross Road",
  "branch_office_city": "Ahmedabad",
  "branch_office_state": "Gujarat",
  "branch_office_zip": "380015",
  "branch_office_phone": "07913445678",
  "branch_office_fax": "07924654321",
  "branch_office_email": "ahmedabad@company.com",
  "branch_office_website": "https://www.company.com",
  "branch_office_contact_name": "Rahul Shah",
  "branch_office_contact_phone": "9876534210",
  "branch_office_contact_email": "rahul.shatesth@company.com",
  "organization": "2dfe251d-e9ea-4a4e-9966-1e4689f36848",
  "branch_office_contact_relationship": "b905d695-c12a-4b07-90fb-e34da76368b9",
  "is_active": true
}

 ```

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `branch_office_name` | string | Name of the branch office. |
| `branch_office_code` | string | Unique code for the branch office. |
| `branch_office_address` | string | Address of the branch office. |
| `branch_office_city` | string | City where the branch office is located. |
| `branch_office_state` | string | State of the branch office. |
| `branch_office_zip` | string | Zip code for the branch office location. |
| `branch_office_phone` | string | Phone number of the branch office. |
| `branch_office_fax` | string | Fax number for the branch office. |
| `branch_office_email` | string | Email for the branch office. |
| `branch_office_website` | string | Website URL of the branch office. |
| `branch_office_contact_name` | string | Name of the contact person at the branch office. |
| `branch_office_contact_phone` | string | Contact person's phone number. |
| `branch_office_contact_email` | string | Contact person's email. |
| `organization` | UUID | UUID of the organization to which the branch office belongs. |
| `branch_office_contact_relationship` | UUID | UUID of the contact relationship (e.g., Father, Mother, etc.). |
| `is_active` | boolean | Status of the branch office (true = active, false = inactive). |

---

**Successful Response**:

```
jsonCopyEdit{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Branch office created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": "15ae0f4f-7b0c-4c91-a845-8da4afe01a53",
        "created_at": "2025-04-28T14:44:55.853494Z",
        "updated_at": null,

        "branch_office_code": "AMD021",
        "branch_office_address": "123 Satellite Road, Near Iskon Cross Road",
        "branch_office_city": "Ahmedabad",

request.description:
**API Name**: Update Branch Office  
**Method**: `PUT`  
**URL**: `{{BaseUrl}}branch-office/{id}/`  
_(Replace_ `_{id}_` _with the actual branch office ID.)_

**Description**:  
  
Updates the details of an existing branch office.

---

**Request Body (JSON)**:

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "branch_office_name": "Ahmedabad Updated Branch",
  "branch_office_code": "AMD022",
  "branch_office_address": "456 New Road, Near Science Park",
  "branch_office_city": "Ahmedabad",
  "branch_office_state": "Gujarat",
  "branch_office_zip": "380016",
  "branch_office_phone": "07923456789",
  "branch_office_fax": "07923456789",
  "branch_office_email": "ahmedabad_updated@company.com",
  "branch_office_website": "https://www.updatedcompany.com",
  "branch_office_contact_name": "Rahul Shah",
  "branch_office_contact_phone": "9876543211",
  "branch_office_contact_email": "rahul.updated@company.com",
  "organization": "2dfe251d-e9ea-4a4e-9966-1e4689f36848",
  "branch_office_contact_relationship": "b905d695-c12a-4b07-90fb-e34da76368b9",
  "is_active": true
}

 ```

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `branch_office_name` | string | Updated name of the branch office. |
| `branch_office_code` | string | Updated unique code for the branch office. |
| `branch_office_address` | string | Updated address of the branch office. |
| `branch_office_city` | string | Updated city of the branch office. |
| `branch_office_state` | string | Updated state of the branch office. |
| `branch_office_zip` | string | Updated zip code for the branch office. |
| `branch_office_phone` | string | Updated phone number for the branch office. |
| `branch_office_fax` | string | Updated fax number for the branch office. |
| `branch_office_email` | string | Updated email for the branch office. |
| `branch_office_website` | string | Updated website URL of the branch office. |
| `branch_office_contact_name` | string | Updated contact person for the branch office. |
| `branch_office_contact_phone` | string | Updated contact person phone number. |
| `branch_office_contact_email` | string | Updated contact person email. |
| `organization` | UUID | UUID of the organization associated with the branch office. |
| `branch_office_contact_relationship` | UUID | UUID of the contact relationship (e.g., Father, Mother, etc.). |
| `is_active` | boolean | Updated status of the branch office (true = active, false = inactive). |

---

**Response (Success)**:

```
jsonCopyEdit{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Branch office updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": "15ae0f4f-7b0c-4c91-a845-8da4afe01a53",
        "created_at": "2025-04-28T14:44:55.853494Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-04-28T15:00:00.000000Z",
        "branch_office_name": "Ahmedabad Updated Branch",
        "branch_office_code": "AMD022",
        "branch_office_address": "456 New Road, Near Science Park",
        "branch_office_city": "Ahmedabad",
        "branch_office_state": "Gujarat",
        "branch_office_zip": "380016",
        "branch_office_phone": "07923456789",
        "branch_office_fax": "07923456789",
        "branch_office_email": "ahmedabad_updated@company.com",
        "branch_office_website": "https://www.updatedcompany.com",
        "branch_office_contact_name": "Rahul Shah",
        "branch_office_contact_phone": "9876543211",
        "branch_office_contact_email": "rahul.updated@company.com",
        "is_active": true,
        "created_by": null,
        "updated_by": null,
        "organization": "2dfe251d-e9ea-4a4e-9966-1e4689f36848",
        "branch_office_contact_relationship": "b905d695-c12a-4b07-90fb-e34da76368b9"
    }
}

 ```

---

### Notes:

- The **GET** request will retrieve all branch office records linked to the organization.
    
- The **PUT** request allows you to update an existing branch office using its unique ID. The updated values should be provided in the request body.
    
- The **id** should be a valid branch office ID in the URL for the **PUT** request.
